comments.body: This will execute the check many times, can you use `_.throttle` like we use [here](https://github.com/edwardmuel/Rocket.Chat/blob/870d42152c00a05fc3e2eec3dcabe86526d26de5/packages/rocketchat-ui/views/app/room.coffee?ts=2#L321) ?

You could say the same thing about the wheel/mousewheel events. With the current event listeners, if a frictionless scrollwheel is used, then the check will also happen rapidly until the wheel slows down.

With a throttle, there would be chance that `atBottom` will not be set back to `true`, causing a new issue where the client does not autoscroll when new messages are received.
I already know this would cause issues for me. Sometimes my mouse's scroll wheel misfires causing it to scroll up and then back down very quickly.
